list_page_teaser: Spoiler Alert!  If you have not seen Season 1, do not click!  What sort of personality types survive the best in a brutal world where the possibility of instanteous death lurks over everyone like a cloud?  Click to find out this and more!
description_html:
This gallery contains images of the personalities of the main members of House Greyjoy from the show Game of Thrones. Click on one of the images on this page to see a full-sized image on its own page.

GoT: The Big Picture

There are dozens of characters in Game of Thrones. Sadly, this site cannot do justice to the vast number of relationships in the show because it is designed for presenting individual images.

Fortunately there are two Visualizing Game of Thrones Personalities books available. To learn more about these books, click on SEE THE STORY!
story_html:
The large number of characters on Game of Thrones gives fans of the show the opportunity to see patterns in personalities. For example, out of 42 characters, I found 10 ESTJs and 8 ISTJs, but only 1 ENFJ (Melisandre) and 1 INFJ (Daenerys). Hmmm, interesting!

Two editions of the book Visualizing Game of Thrones Personalities (VGoTP) are available:

  • VGoTP Mini-ebook Edition — less content and best for phones, 89 pages
  • VGoTP Full Edition: From Ned and Cersei to Tyrion and Daenerys — best for larger screens, 171 pages

Both books begin with a chapter looking at each of the Houses, then go on to include a chapter that compares and contrasts both similar and dissimlar Pairs of people. Following that is a chapter examining Groups of similar personalities, and both editions also include a Character Index and a list of Characters and Their Types at the end.

Additionally, the Full Edition includes an extra chapter offering Insights into some patterns of relationships. Ultimately the Full Edition includes close to twice as much information as the Mini-ebook Edition.

Click one of the links above to get your Visualizing Game of Thrones Personalities book today!

image_list.title: Theon Greyjoy
image_list.subtitle_html: Son of Balon Greyjoy — Before He Meets Ramsay
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Theon's spiritual portrait shows he is outgoing, closed, and realistic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Theon's dominant personality trait, his strong preference for logic over emotion.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He demonstrated this trait in his harsh treatment of the people at Winterfell.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Theon's auxiliary personality trait, his strong preference for realism over idealism.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He demonstrated this trait when he realized that even though he was raised by Ned Stark, he was still Balon Greyjoy's son and heir.

image_list.title: Yara Greyjoy
image_list.subtitle_html: Only Daughter of Balon Greyjoy
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Yara's spiritual portrait shows she is determined, ambitious, and realistic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Yara's dominant personality trait, her objectivity and cool-headedness.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  She demonstrates this trait in the way she can remain calm during battles.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Yara's auxiliary personality trait, her realistic outlook.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  She demonstrated this when she called off the attempt to rescue Theon from Ramsay, realizing that Theon no longer resembled the brother she had known.

image_list.title: Reek
image_list.subtitle_html: Prince Theon after Emasculation by Ramsay Snow
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Reek's spiritual portrait shows he is reticent, vulnerable, and short-sighted.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Reek's dominant personality trait, his tendency to be more emotional than logical.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He demonstrates this trait in the fear he shows of his master, Ramsay Snow.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Reek's auxiliary personality trait, his tendency to be short-sighted and realistic.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He demonstrates this trait in the way he has learned to obey every command coming from his master, Ramsay Snow, and ignore everything else.
